required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intermittent Hypoxia Intervention in MS Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Tolerance of an Intermittent Intervention in MS Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This observational cohort study investigates the safety and feasibility of an intermittent hypoxia intervention in multiple sclerosis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of mean LLS before vs. after 1 hour vs. after 2 hours of each session
primary_outcome.description: Tolerance by measuring the development of acute mountain sickness during the sessions Score 3 to 5 = mild AMS Score 6 or more = severe AMS

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks after starting the intervention, at the end of the intervention (after 3 months)
secondary_outcome.description: MS impairment measurement with a score ranging from 0.0 (normal neurological exam) to 10.0 (death due to MS)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks after starting the intervention, at the end of the intervention (after 3 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Quantitative mobility and leg function performance test based on a timed 25-walk

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks after starting the intervention, at the end of the intervention (after 3 months)
Baseline, 4 weeks after starting the intervention, at the end of the intervention (after 3 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Quantitative test of upper extremity function

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks after starting the intervention, at the end of the intervention (after 3 months)
Baseline, 4 weeks after starting the intervention, at the end of the intervention (after 3 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Test for concentration and decision making

Baseline, 4 weeks after starting the intervention, at the end of the intervention (after 3 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Measure of instrumental activities of daily living (IADL)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks after starting the intervention, at the end of the intervention (after 3 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Measure MS-related cognitive and motor fatigue in MS 43 Mild Fatigue 53 Medium Fatigue 63 Severe Fatigue

secondary_outcome.description: T2 and Gd enhancing T1 lesions

arm_group.description: 2 hours of reduced FiO2 (11-15%) in the inspired air, 2-3x/week, 3 months

study_pop.textblock: MS patients with all types of MS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-60 years
- confirmed MS (all types of MS)
- ability to come to the outpatient clinic 2-3x/week for 3 months
- EDSS ≤ 6.5
- inconspicuous medical examination
- inconspicuous ECG
Exclusion Criteria:
- relapse in the last 3 months
- EDSS progression in the last 6 months
- pregnancy
- contraindication for MRI
- severe heart disease
- severe asthma, COPD
- cancer
- severe cognitive deficits
- chronic headache
- renal insufficiency
- anaemia (Hb < 10 g/dl)
- insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus
- severe vascular stenosis
- former episodes of severe high mountain sickness
- cancer
